They were most probably in the Newport synagogue during George Washington‚Äôs famous visit on August 18, 1790! Today the New York congregation uses them during the High Holidays. #OurSharedHeritage

These finials hold a very special place in Jewish American history: they were used by the two earliest communities in the country, founded by Sephardic (Spanish and Portuguese) Jews in New York and Newport. #OurSharedHeritage
